main event: On December 3, 1957, Naval Air Station personnel in Cape May, New Jersey, observed a very bright object in the southern sky. The object moved slightly to the southwest and then appeared to have an explosion before disappearing beyond the horizon.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 40 minutes, indicating a prolonged sighting of the object.
The object was described as very bright and appeared to move before disappearing, suggesting unusual behavior.
Naval Air Station personnel reported the sighting, adding credibility to the observation.
The object was deemed unknown in the conclusion, indicating that there was insufficient data for evaluation.
Coast Guard station was requested to look for the object, but it disappeared before any action was taken.
sighted object: A very bright object in the southern sky
